intro: Omphalocarpum claessensii, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spherical seed pods that contain a single seed, a feature that gives it its scientific name. It is typically found in grassland habitats and is adapted to dry, seasonal climates. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native environment.
